Call me crazy; I honest to God believe sometimes it's scripted, both to your advantage or the other team's. Like the game is programmed to adjust the probability of shots going in.
I just played a game where the opposing team shot 76% from the field, almost all of the shots were contested. A lot of my passes were tipped. Sometimes the simplest of passes would result in turnovers.
Other times though, it's in your favor. You know, when Durant misses 5 wide open mids in a row and you make every shot you take, open or not.

That free throw tip is MONEY.
All bronze. If you want I'll tell you my full lineup (all 12 players). And I have found two posts on this sub (1 thread and 1 comment) that have helped me tremendously.

Don't spend points on Gold packs. I never do that and I'm perfectly content.
What you wanna do is get the 3 stars against the all star team and test your luck. I get D Rose pretty often with it. After you get 3 stars, start another game up and quit as soon as you are able to to reset the stars for that specific team. Rinse and repeat until you get the players you want. The only thing you will spend MyTeam points on during this process is contracts if you have none left, and they're pretty cheap.
You can get every player on your list with this method, except Wilt. I'm not sure about Curry. For him, do this with the Warriors instead.
For Wilt, shell out the MT points for that random historic pack. It's a shame they didn't extend the packs individually as they promised and made it random.

The prices differ from bronze to gold players. Some bronze players even cost more than other bronzes. For example, T Ross costs 500 MT for 5 contracts, compared to someone like Quincy Acy, who costs only 200 for 5.

WRITING.TITLE: I feel like such an asshole
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm 18, student. It's been over three weeks I'm on vacation, still have one more week to go.
Before the vacation, there was a girl who I thought liked me, so I went ahead and asked for her number so we could do something together between semesters.
I texted her, about two days before Christmas. We talked for a bit, and I told her w'd do something after Christmas.
This whole vacation, I've been feeling lazy. Not in a bad, depressing way. I just wanna stay in and enjoy some video games I couldn't play during the semester due to school work. Either that or kick back with some guy friends. I'm not sad by any means. I'm generally a happy guy who can easily make people smile.
I haven't contacted her since. I talked to my sister about it. She told me girls in general expect a guy to keep his word.
It's not that I'm nervous, I just don't feel like putting any effort in right now. I don't wanna be on her bad side though. I don't care if I get rejected.
Just take the win and the points. You missed out of 4 wins and 18k points. It's a cheap tactic but what can you do

For people having this problem (happened to me with the Knicks), make a throwaway lineup, load the game up with the team you want, and quit as soon as you get past the loading screen. The stars should be reset fir that team.
It's by no means ok for 2k to scam you out if packs, but I've gotten dozens of 3 star packs using this method.

WRITING.TITLE: May someone explain to me what the Derrick Rose rule is and why it was established?

WRITING.TEXT: It's not super secret lol I replied to the other guy in this thread. Have fun!
Evidently, for the game you will quit, use a throwaway lineup (bronze players you don't plan on ever using).

If you wanna reset stars for a certain team in Domination, load that game up, and as soon as you get past the loading screen, just press start a quit. The stars will be reset. I do this all the time with the all stars team. I have every player from that 3 star pack, so I always get duplicates which sell for a lot of points.
Domination for MT points. I get 19k-20k a game by using the resetting stars glitch with the nba all star team. I'm sure you've heard of it.
